definitions.text: the pitch range of the highest female voice
having or denoting a high range
examples: the boy still had a fine treble voice

definitions.text: three times as great or many
examples: a claim for treble (or triple) damages

definitions.text: having three units or components or elements
examples: a treble row of red beads
triple time has three beats per measure

definitions.text: having more than one decidedly dissimilar aspects or qualities; ; - R.W.Emerson; -Frederick Harrison
examples: a double (or dual) role for an actor
the office of a clergyman is twofold; public preaching and private influence
every episode has its double and treble meaning
